definition: to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters
(old) jade tablet (a ceremonial badge of rank)
to seal/to close/to confine/to seal off/to close down/sealed/confined/closed/unreceptive
to sequester/to seize (assets)/to seal up/to close down
Kaifeng prefecture-level city in Henan, old capital of Northern Song, former provincial capital of Henan/old name Bianliang 汴梁
to sequester/to seal up (for safe keeping)/to freeze (an account)/to mothball

to put a roof (on a building)/to cap the roof (finishing a building project)/fig. to put a ceiling (on spending, prize, ambition etc)/to top off/fig. to reach the highest point (of growth, profit, interest rates)/to stop growing (of plant bud or branch)
to encapsulate/to enclose/to wrap/to seal inside
covered in dust/dusty/lying unused for a long time

sentences.english: Write her a short love letter.
Acouple of months ago a friend asked if I'd write her a job reference.
sentences.chinese: 幾個月前，一位朋友問我是否能幫她寫封求職推薦信。

sentences.english: We fix it, pierce in several places and put into the oven.
sentences.chinese: 將塑料袋封好，然後在上面搓幾處小孔，放入烤箱。

sentences.english: We publish about 35 letters each week.
sentences.chinese: 我們每週大約發表35封信件。

sentences.english: It was the same when he was 7)knighted.
sentences.chinese: 他受封爲爵士時也是如此。

sentences.english: Always get at least a testimonial when they say how happy they are.
sentences.chinese: 當有人說他多高興時別忘了至少要封感謝信。

sentences.english: She pored her eyes out over his letters.
sentences.chinese: 她因看了他的好多封來信，把眼睛都看花了。

sentences.english: He neglected to reply to the invitation.
sentences.chinese: 他忘記封那邀請作答覆。

sentences.english: Cables in the holes which should be sealed should be arranged and cleared up.
sentences.chinese: 將需封孔洞中的電纜作必要的排列整理。

sentences.english: He is an intelligent boy, but he is very unsure of himself.
sentences.chinese: 他是個聰明的孩子，卻封自己很沒有信心。

sentences.english: Evans wrote me a short note from shanghai .
sentences.chinese: 埃文斯從上海給我寫了封短簡。

sentences.english: Promotion is to take his brother to a lot of love letter, in order to return of pursuers.
sentences.chinese: 晉升還爲帶弟擬好多封情信，以回贈追求者。

sentences.english: A drop-leg pipe connects the valves to the dead-headed diaphragm housing.
sentences.chinese: 氣體分流管將閥連接到滑封隔膜套。

sentences.english: So, you're afraid you've bricked your router.
sentences.chinese: 所以，你害怕你已經用磚頭封你的路由器。

sentences.english: Your claim check is stapled in the back of your ticket jacket .
sentences.chinese: 你的認領單釘在票封的背面。

definition: to seal up (a door with a paper seal, or a document)/to confer an additional title on a nobleman
to receive fief and title/to be enfeoffed/(fig.) to be rewarded by the emperor
title granted to a person (archaic)/to ban an (online) account
marquis, second of the five orders of ancient Chinese nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/nobleman or high official
to win the championship/(of an emperor) to bestow the title of king on a subject
to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
to appoint sb to a post or confer a title on sb by imperial order
